index
Inserting the value of a
calculated indicator
created earlier into the algorithm.
Syntax
index
(index)
Setting
Purpose
index
A computable indicator.
Note
The function is called using
located on the Sources tab in the algorithm editor.
A modal window opens in which a previously created
calculated indicator
is selected from the list.
Example
It is necessary to assess the financial state of the client.
The value of the assess is determined by the "Financial state"
analytical range
with the return value of the reference value. The estimate is calculated according to the calculated indicator "The number of points scored as a result of the assessment".
That is, depending on the value of the indicator "The number of points scored as a result of the assessment", the function will assess the financial state of the Client based on the specified ranges of the table (analytical range).
The value of the analytical range is returned by the
rangeToObj
function.
The value of the calculated indicator is set by the
index
function.
The assessment result is an object attribute. Possible evaluation values: average, good, bad.
